messages.message:
To curb people signing up over and over for free credits once aihub gets more popular, we should enable MFA with phone numbers and store people’s unique numbers. Then we verify against phone numbers before just handing credits to any new account.

(I tried this with open ai and that’s what they did)

Good thinking, but note that it can bite some people in unfortunate ways, so I'd recommend that other features (such as changing account email address) are in place before such a rule is implemented.

I had an Open AI account at my last job (I've been working with their tools since before GPT-3), then our company got bought by another and I had to create a new account with the new email address.  And when ChatGPT came out, I decided it'd be good to have a personal login to access it.  However, they wouldn't let me create a personal account since my number had been used for 2 other accounts already.
@Eric Han let’s do it once we get wildly popular :slightly_smiling_face:
Majority of the registered users haven’t consumed even 10% of their free credits. We don’t have an abuse problem right now.
